hints_html: Which numbers near 48 are perfect squares? What are their square roots?
hints_latex: Which numbers near 48 are perfect squares? What are their square roots?
hints_raw: Which numbers near 48 are perfect squares?  What are their square roots?
question: C 03 (a)
sols_html:
The number 48 is between perfect squares 36 and 49, so we have:

\(\begin{array}{rcl} 36 &< 48 &< 49 \\ \sqrt{36} &< \sqrt{48} &< \sqrt{49} \\ 6 &< b &< 7 \end{array}\)
sols_latex:
The number 48 is between perfect squares 36 and 49, so we have:

$\begin{array}{rcl}
36 &< 48 &< 49 \\
\sqrt{36} &< \sqrt{48} &< \sqrt{49} \\
6 &< b &< 7 \end{array}$
sols_raw:
The number 48 is between perfect squares 36 and 49, so we have:

<math> \begin{array}{rcl}
36 &< 48 &< 49 \\
\sqrt{36} &< \sqrt{48} &< \sqrt{49} \\
6 &< b &< 7 \end{array}</math>
statement_html:
This question is about approximating the value of \(b = \sqrt{48}\).

(a) Between which two successive integers does b lie?
statement_latex:
This question is about approximating the value of $b = \sqrt{48}$.

\textbf{(a)} Between which two successive integers does \emph{b} lie?
statement_raw:
This question is about approximating the value of <math> b = \sqrt{48} </math>.

'''(a)''' Between which two successive integers does ''b'' lie?
